pageContext.description: Edges fairly sharp. Socket broken and only hollow to point marked A.
pageContext.patina: Dark green brown. Scratched vertically, dull golden bronze shows.
pageContext.other: Width: blade 26mm; socket 11mm,Thickness: blade 10mm; socket 13mm,Weight: 33.66 gms
pageContext.collection: Shrewsbury Museum,Presented by W.H.O. Lander, Esq., Tibberton Grange, Nr. Newport, Salop, 1928
pageContext.site: England,Shropshire,Edgmond (civil),(Tibberton-cum-Cherinton) (eccles),In a wet field called the Gammer (pronounced Gawmer) situated on the edge of Dayhouse Moor. Found some 15 years ago by Mr. Ed. Yardley (workman of Cherrington) in a wet field, then under plough.,(Found about 10 inches down),(Heavy loamy boulder clay.)
